Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	And now begins the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, if you have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the completion of its purpose, and for its explanations, and for its declarations, it seems to me that I have completed what I promised to you in this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of castration was prohibited in our region and time, until the science of it was greatly unknown, and its existence was hidden; and no one practiced it except a few small descriptions in the books of the ancients, which were mostly errors and uncertainties until the understanding of it was closed and its length and art were extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will live in the order of this treatise in the second way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of the tools of cautery and of the other instruments of the work, which is necessary for addition to the declaration, and for preparation of it.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	In ancient times, the reason why a skilled surgeon did not immediately know how to use their hand in this art of medicine was because the science of anatomy was long forgotten, and it was necessary to relearn it through the knowledge of the joints and forms of the members, and their conjunction and separation; and to understand the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and their connection; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations of their exit.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And as Hippocrates said that a name is not important, but in the work itself, and especially in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned that person in the introduction of this book; because those who do not know what we have said about anatomy will not avoid errors that cause people to die, as I have seen too many of them, because they are formed in this science and obtain knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a doctor who was foolish and had incurred an abscess called carbuncle on the neck of a woman, and he incised some arteries of the neck so that great blood flowed into her body, which caused her to die among the most.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And another doctor saw that the dragon had swallowed a stone from a man who had died, and the stone was large, and it came to him and passed through his stomach, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already called for someone to remove it, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the position of the patient, I knew that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And another doctor took on the case of a duke from our land for surgery, and he was brought to a skilled blacksmith who was experienced in fractures; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he passed through the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and strong structures, and did not allow air to the wound.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he removed the splint according to his desires, and removed the bandage, and removed the dressing for several days and commanded that we remove the bandage; and at this point, the wound and the foot became infected, and it reached a dangerous point.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to remove the bandage, and then he felt relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption was already confirmed in the limb, so I could not stop it, and I did not cease to walk with the patient until he recovered.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced an abscess with cancer, and it became ulcerous in a few days, until the fire of his malice destroyed him.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the cranium is purged of melancholic humor, so it does not come to him from all iron, but rather that the member which suffers from all should be held.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that reason, children, it is necessary for you to perform the operation in two stages: one in which health is associated with it, and another in which it is performed in the most favorable positions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed in all places where this book is found, in which the operation is performed in which there is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard that and lay aside that one, so that the people do not approach you to dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your arms in care and protection of God, and your patients in success and stability.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method by the grace of God for their salvation and praiseworthy succession, and lay aside the terrible diseases of difficult healing, and keep your arms in that which causes you to fear, so that your perseverance in your faith and in your name will not be abandoned: because more remains to your glory, and further in the world and after to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	It has been said in some of these situations:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad disease, because evil doctors will not be recognized.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already devised this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The beginning of the division of the book, and first of the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter arranged in the form of the foot, in the forms of instruments and in the materials of cautery, and of that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and puncturing, and on wounds, and on sores, and on the extraction of splinters and similar objects from them, all chapters and ordered by the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of twisting and similar injuries to them; chapter ordered by the head within the foot, and by the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of pointed cautery and acute medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that, the treatise begins on all the free.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you know the quality of those points of that cautery and of its needles, and in what condition it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So say that the speech of the quality of the point of cautery and of its needle of it is long and prolix, and subtle for knowledge, and secretly hidden; and from there to speak many people of secrets, and of those they are disagreed, and to me a little of their speeches, I fear extension.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so it is said that the pointed cautery brings comfort to the entire universal composition, which is called matter or its matter, except for two compositions, which are tail compositions of matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the tail composition of matter, it is said that the pointed cautery is beneficial to it; others say the opposite, that the pointed cautery is not suitable for ailments that are caused by quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is unsuitable for tail compositions of matter to be healed with heat.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite, that by using the pointed cautery, it is beneficial in all tail compositions of matter that are found in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of a man and its moisture to the composition of fire, the body of a man is often injured.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that one who has experimented with this at some times past.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But may not come over that one who has already been proven and practiced in the chapter of cautery by previous practice, and has known the diversity of the composition of men and the disposition of their illnesses in their members, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other body parts, do not fear for yourself, and especially in wet and humid diseases, where all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree about the use of a pointed cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Know, children, that the secret of healing by pointed cautery and fire is because fire is simple, its action reaching only the member being cauterized and not the other members unless they are nearby and slightly harmed.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the pointed cautery reaches those in the members who are nearby, and it often brings relief to the sick member and is often used.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	The fire, due to its greatness and goodness of substance, does not do more than what is necessary, and we know this from experience and long study of the art over the truth of causes; and for this reason you should be excused from the length of this sermon. If it were not for this, your secret would have been hidden in this pause about the fire, and the quality of the operation of it in the body and its expulsion of diseases, which is a philosophical demonstration, would have been revealed to you.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And wisely, sons, know that they should be separated from the time in which it is most convenient to perform cauterization and pause at the best time of first daylight.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cauterization is convenient at all times, because the time that is submerged in the juice of which the cauterizing instrument is made, and especially if it is for painful or necessary pains, quickly and strongly, the ones that do not suffer delay because of the fear of those who come with malice, which is greater than small harm entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not catheterize in your feet, or, sons, that is only estimated by the common people and foolish doctors, because that evil which is cured by cauterization is not reduced all at once, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as it is said above, because cauterization is not only in a place of medicine that alters the complexion and dries out the moisture, which are the causes of pain coming.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, excessive cauterization above the medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the patient's illness returns in some hours of time, according to the complexity of the patient and the location of their illness, and the virtue of it, and that which is prepared in the body of the patient from the accumulation of superfluities in it, and that which is obtained by him in his acquisition of foods and similar causes; but if the disease in which it is administered cauterization is a subtle illness in a member of few superfluities and humidity, as with the tooth cautery for pain and similar causes, it is possible that in it does not return that pain, but rather something else is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And furthermore, common speech is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and correct speech is not to that which I understand in it, because they believe that there is no cure that profits from medicine or another cause that approaches cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and understanding that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is not but when administering the methods of cure in some illnesses, and those medicines do not confer, and at the end of the cause they administer such cauterization, and it profits at that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here it is customarily understood that the pointed cautery is the second tool of medicine, not the understanding of which the common people and many foolish doctors are ignorant.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold cautery is better than iron cautery, and they did not say otherwise except for the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of cautery does not hurt, since it is not absolutely straight, because you already have some that heats and has some that does not heat at all, and gold cautery is good and better than iron cautery; however, when you make cautery with fire, do not say so, because it is prepared according to the quantity that you want by the roughness of the gold, and because it receives the cold; and if you adjust it on the fire, the gold melts for the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because it is made with iron cautery, you must make it slightly and more properly in the direction of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the second chapter of the cautery, and have ordered those between the feet, so that they may ask him what he wants from there.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain caused by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers the moisture and cold that are the main causes of this accident, which is called gout, from the head to the parts of the joints and fingers fluent, and many of sleep, and pain in the teeth and jaw, and universally of all evil that comes from cold, such as paralysis, suddenness, apoplexy, and similarities in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first command the patient to take laxative medicine to cleanse his head for three or four nights, according to the patient's condition and age.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then do this action between your hands on a low stool, and place your hand over his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place your thumb on the surface of the nose, between his nostrils.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the area you mentioned is reached, mark that spot and then remove the pointed cautery, which has the following shape:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the spot well and gently, so that it does not press too tightly at once, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slightly lift your hand and look at the spot, and if you see that some of the bone has been exposed, as much as the amount of gravel, then lift your hand, and if it does not return to its place, bring your hand back to that iron, or another one of those, if it is cold, before it is seen from the bone what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve that on the spot and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place a soft cloth on that spot and leave it there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area with the quadruple medicine before it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the plague is opened, as much pain gets to the arm, so it is better and more useful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that one should cauterize the neck through the bone, and hold the cautery until some part of the bone is stuck together.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which is stuck to the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the back, before it penetrates the bone strongly enough to break the bone, and this is the way to make a small incision:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that place the fumes of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And it should be kept open for a long time, and then cured before it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two kinds of cautery in all people, only in those who are secondarily afraid; and if you leave that one, I advise you, it is better to save the head when it is possible, because the head is developed by the solution of continuity of which there is evidence in other members, and more so when the head of the patient is naturally free.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better for me, and from that one and the other work, it saves health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter two.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is constant and long pain in the whole head, and it is prolonged in the patient, and they use garlics, and hooks, and capipurges, and ointments, and guatz, and cadels, and gualinas, and similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a certain cauterizer that does not help at all, then consider this: if the head of the patient is naturally very strong; and not easily broken, then use another cauterizer.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the top of their head with a certain cauterizer when the crown is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the crown and expose the bone as much as we have found and cauterize that with a certain cauterizer in the part behind the head in the place called the fontanelle, — and that is the place where the cushion is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And let your hand rest on the bone, and do not expose it, because the patient will suffer great pain different from the pain of all other cautery heads of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I would say that this cautery is in the place, because it covers the part of the head that is cauteryed with the toes of the foot and the occipital region is a more subtle cautery than the one that cauterizes the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient cauterying of the eyebrow.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the pain in the part of the head is very intense, or if it extends to the temple, remove the medicines that are applied to the head and administer the other cure, which I have mentioned in the chapters on diseases; and in no case should this cauterization be done with an acute cautery or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But if you use a cautery that is burning, then take a hollow reed and scrape it and apply the ends of it to the parts where the other cautery heads are.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then approach the location of the pain with a curved blade inserted into the wound that is in its place behind the skin, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure to the stopped area with a tight bandage, and leave it for three hours; and then remove the dressing and treat the wound for two or three days, and then apply a poultice over the affected area where the wound is located.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that one until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do that with some burning medicines which I have written about in the other treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The cauterization is done in this way: ignite with the following method:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a clover-like cautery, where the head of it is like a crocus flower in which there is some curvature, and at the middle of it is a small hollow.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand over the location of the pain, and remove your hand — so that the skin is not stuck to the area which has been left — and rotate the small iron at speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that is stuck due to the thickness of the cord is such that it covers the entire body, and lift your hand to prevent the artery from being stuck, so that no bleeding occurs.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a salted water dressing on that area and place it over the wound for three days; then apply a healing ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the end of the knife according to the cautery, and be careful not to cut the artery in this manner.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an ancient wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an ancient wound with the cure we mentioned in the previous chapter and the cure we mentioned in the divisions of illnesses, and if you do not improve the cure, and see that the illness does not respond to the first cauterization with medicine or the cauterization with fire, then wait until the cauterization is healed, because it means that there is a line of long bones underneath the pain area or where that is; and place your hand over it and push it until you reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuation of the jawbone, which is damaged by chewing, and that the muscle not be stuck and the nerve that causes it, and that it does not become spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the guard and care of the flow of blood from the artery that is being punctured, where in the puncture of it there is fear, and more so for those who do not know what it is and are not studied or skilled; and leave the operation in it at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find the memory of the rule for the flow of blood from the artery according to its method, in its own location in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not allow this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it at the middle location of the head as we have reported, and cure the wound before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you apply the cautery that we have said in the chapter of stretching of the artery with a two-pronged cautery, and this cauterization is better and more suitable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of gout pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the big toe due to cold and it is cured by removing the causes or the other cure mentioned in the previous section, and the pain does not return, then apply the cautery, and this is the one that has no point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then approach the point to the heat of the cautery, and place it around the entire big toe as if it were rotated, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	With the cautery, carefully approach the edge of the big toe little by little until you have reached the place without harming the area.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of the point is in the entire big toe, and you have reached it, then quickly treat the places until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture, which is cured and can only be treated by the specific means that come from flexion, as we have said in the sections of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the affected area due to dryness or spasms of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that area of torture with jerras and capipurgi and guarguarismes, and do not compare your treatment, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first from the golden needle, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your hand on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening only occurs in the healthy part.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The form of cauterization is that you cauterize that area with the cauteri in the right side of the golden needle, a little above the corn on the cap, and in the temple another, the longest of which should be second to the length of the said point, and place your hand over the cauteri until the quantity of the majority of the species of the codex is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauteri, and it is specific to the cutellari, the form of which is given in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	May it be remembered that there is a certain remedy for this; and cover the affected area with a cloth to prevent excessive waste.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then care for the affected area with the remedy until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the ancient cauterization of apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and is treated with the remedy we have mentioned, and the patient does not have fever, then cauterize that area with four cautery irons: over all the bones of the head; and with the cautery iron, on the temple, as we have said; and with the cautery iron in the groin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of using the cautery is done as described above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is deeper; and then care for the affected area with the remedy as it progresses.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cauterization of memory loss caused by a blow.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Gave large and round pills to the patient at the beginning of the treatment.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then remove the entire cap from the patient and place it on the area described in this treatise about plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And then place some cold compresses, which are made of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do the same as the previous method that was mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if those remedies are effective; and if not, then make three pointed cautery marks on the back part of his head, which should be placed from the most inner part of the head to the most outer part of the head.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the largest amount of the mentioned plaster between each cautery, and then care for the cautery as it is proceeding.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you feel more pain and the patient is able to bear it, then make the cautery in the middle location; and if you feel greater pain, then make the cautery on both feet.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	And care for that until it is healed; and let the cautery be made of olive oil according to the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter Nine
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cautery of the perineum and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You have already processed in the softening of the head and that we have said; and then remove the patient's head, and then cauterize with that cautery at the middle location of the head, and cauterize over all the corners of the head, and cauterize over the back part of it, and three cauteries on the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the patient's softening of the body of those and the tolerable patients and the illness is strong, then cauterize with that cautery over four cauteries on the spine of the back, and afterwards cauterize into where is a little bit of the neck of it, and raise the tieua hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then care for that until it is healed, and this is cautery oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter Ten
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cautery of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized but that epilepsy is by fluctuation.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so, at the beginning of the patient's illness, you should modify their brain with the other treatment that we have mentioned in the division when the patient is large and tolerant to the exception of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medications, then administer garlic and mustard to the servant who modifies them, giving them this for several days, with good nutrition.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head, and cauterize that area with a cautery in the middle of their head according to the previous method, and with another cautery at the back of their head, and over each hair on their head, cauterize it.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize that area with cautery as I have mentioned, having paralysis and softness of the body over the spines of the neck and the spines of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And if the cauterization is done with oil as previously mentioned.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause the cautery subtly according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted and become wet and thick, then cauterize those parts with the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and tends towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is wet, then give him to drink that which purifies his brain according to the water that has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a circular incision carefully on his head, and place a bandage in that location.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be lying down, and held from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply the liniment; and it is more suitable for an ancient sheep's bladder.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that on the fire to warm up, which the patient says relieves his suffering when it is in him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply that in the middle location of his head in the circle, and let it enter him before it is mixed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And give that patient all the medicine in the week, or according to another regimen until they are healed; or if you want, make small points on the most affected part with a pointed cautery, but hold your hand with a cautery ready: this is a special cauterizing tool that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And place your hand on that swollen part in wheat flour or in grayish-white flour.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the descent of water on the back.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you that the beginning of water on the back occurs through the senses that I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give that patient the water that melts the head of him, and keep that from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that patient sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And command that patient to shake their head, and make small points on the middle of the head with a pointed cautery; and then make small points on two temples if it is the beginning of water in two backs, or on one latz if it is the beginning of water in one back.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut all the veins and tendons that are located behind the ankle; and place the cautery in that far location on the side of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see any bleeding from there, apply some medicine that is at your disposal.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you should know the skill of extracting tendons and treating those abscesses and preventing blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some cautery is applied to the neck behind two bones and between two other cautery.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the forehead are very old and through the veins and arteries that are in that location manifest of the cap and it is verified that this is superfluous and flexible, then cauterize that with the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on beginning of water in the forehead, and with the cautery in the middle of the head and with two cautery in the neck behind two temples, and with two cautery in the neck behind two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	If it is necessary to cauterize the vein on the side of the head above the temple with a small cautery, then do so in all length of the vein.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	About the cauterization of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the patient with the remedy that we mentioned in the division and have not yet completed your treatment, then prepare and give to the patient three spoons of honey; then remove the cap from their head, and cauterize the vein with a small cautery or olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize the vein with a clove cautery or two small cauteries on both temples, just behind the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the arch that you do not burn it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the clove cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	About the cauterization of the eyelids to soften them.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a small cautery or this crescent-shaped cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	If you apply a small pointed cautery between the two eyebrows and extend it to both temples, it will relieve the pain.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	The length of each cautery should be according to the thickness of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press your hand too hard on the cautery, but according to the thickness of the eyelid that is stuck together.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the eyelid cautery when the eyelashes are converted to the parts and poke the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent. Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz. E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for it until it is healed.

And then take some known and living worms, and if you do not know how to do that, and mix those causes with bread, and make a poultice of that so that it is not dispersed; and then spread that over the paper that was made there with the shape of a myrtle bandage, and place that over the affected area; and place the head of the patient in the upright position on a pillow, and the cap of the patient should be on his head.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc. E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And if the sting continues, then remove the medicine and wipe the patient's back with a cloth; when the sting ceases, return the medicine and wash the affected area with clean water; and then consider whether the eyelid has been raised as it was during the operation, because it is now healed; and if not, return to the previous step of applying the medicine to the area where it did not sting and was not denigrated before being fully healed.

And it is necessary for you to keep constant vigilance during the operation that no medicine falls out of the wound, and if the eyelid becomes soft and there is any cause of hairs in the wound, then repeat the medicine on the area where the eyelid becomes soft, as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the method of midwifery.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the bones of men are varied according to their size and strength, and therefore your contraction is made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not hide the right path to him who studies this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cautery for a fistula that is in the lacrimal canal of the bone.

Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is moisture and humidity in the stomach that has not been removed from its composition and multiplied many times, and if you continue with the methods of treatment and do not confirm, then the patient should be laid on their back, and their arms extended, and then cauterize with three cautery: one cautery under the chest for the length of a clavilh cautery, and two cautery under the ribs of the cautery, forming a triangular figure; and stretch out those that are not adjusted to prevent them from being damaged.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery corresponds to the thickness of the two tires of the carriage.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And if the shape of the cautery is like this, then use a large cautery in the middle of the stomach in this form; and this is a cautery in the form of a circle in this form.
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And if the stomach is cauterized at the point where this cautery frightens it: and you should place your hand on the stomach point according to the quantity that you want to test, and then cauterize those points with this cautery; and then cure them with the remedy that is preceded before they are healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of the cauterization of the foot.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain in the foot occurs due to cold or moisture or heavy wind before its normal composition is disturbed by excessive discharge, and it is cured with the remedy that we have said and not otherwise, then let the patient lie on their back, and place your hand on the foot, and test three cauteries in this form and this quantity on the foot below the ribs, where the human body lies.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And the space between each cautery should be according to the largest part of the aforementioned, and the cautery should be according to the length of the body straightened.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not understand the reason for the pointed cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of that which is attached to the quantity of the bottom of the codex is not adjusted; and if the patient is standing on his feet, then let him sit down, who has already extended his limbs, and raised his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these pointed cautery with a pointed cautery, when there is your subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to proceed too much in the cauterization, and let the bottom of the codex be attached for all the body and reach into the intestines, where the codex is thin; and know that.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of puncturing an abscess on the thigh with a pointed cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When the swelling or abscess on the thigh is ended and you want to know if that abscess is in the meat of the thigh or in its membrane, then if it is in the meat of the thigh, the patient's weight and pain are increased.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the membrane of the thigh, then the pain is greatly increased and often fatigues doctors with its treatment.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, turn the patient on their side; and then feel the location of the abscess and try to puncture it; and then ignite the cautery that is shaped like a needle, the form of which has been described in the other page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And burn it with that and cautery until all the sinew is coagulated, until it reaches the bone, until it penetrates the bone.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that by the treatment of other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this form of cautery except that of which the study in the art of medicine is prolonged, and in which many bad outcomes have been known; rather, this experiment has been done on this operation, but it is better to leave it to those who know better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of plantar warts.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauterization method of the warts on the feet, according to this manner, is to take a long dry bark from aristology, a sharp pointed bark that can be found, and it should be of the largest size.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then immerse that in oil and place it in the fire, and cauterize with a cauterizer in that location which is between the continuity of the scapula and the neck; and with two small cauterizers placed side by side, one declining slightly towards the part that was left by the beard, and two more cauterizers in that place where they decline between the fifth rib and the lumbar region, declining slightly towards the back; and another cauterizer on the chest; and three cauterizers on the parts of the back; and another cauterizer in that location which is between the two scapulas, and two more cauterizers on the sides of the chest, after the one that is between the two scapulas.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not cover your hand with the pointed cautery, but keep it in the open air of the work area.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And the ancient authorities say that the men who use pointed cautery-like irons similar to a ray and ignite them, then place them in the location between the ribs, until they reach the other apostema and it is removed, as we have said about the pustule of the finger.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	In this perforation, do not be afraid of the pointed cautery, because it has often happened in the location of the fistula that does not heal.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cauterization of the mouth.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you cure the mouth of the patient, do not compare your cure with what we have said about the division, but instead cauterize it in three ways, all of which are corrective, one of which is to make three or four cautery marks along the length of the mouth according to the shape of the cautery of the finger, whose figure has been given.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment. E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not place your hand on the cautery; and the patient should be on their side.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And another way to cauterize is that you ignite the cautery having two tines, which we mentioned in the chapter of dislocation of the muscle, and lift the suture that is at the end of the hamstring, which is causing the pain of the patient's left side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And your elevation should be the one that lifts the suture according to the length of the body, so that the points can be made according to the latitude of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two tines, light one, in that moment when those penetrate the suture of the other part.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus four points are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you see, cauterize with the cautery having three tines.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you should cure the pointed cautery so that it does not cause pain for too many days, as it is more common than other previous causes of cure.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of the cauterization of hydrocele.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Do not use a pointed cautery in hydrocele, but rather a proper one.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you cure the hydrocele, follow the methods of treatment that we have mentioned in the division and do not compare your treatment, then cover that person with four cautery needles around the navel and one cautery on their stomach, and another cautery on their chest, and another cautery on their back, and two cautery needles between their ribs, and one cautery in the right side of their chest, and another cautery on their stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the skin.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the cautery in place so that it does not cause pain for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from treatment near the pointed cautery that heals quickly so that they can be joined to each other, and served with quick aid for recovery.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the pointed cautery that is cauterized on the belly should be according to its previous form, and the one that is cauterized on the back should be according to its previous shape.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.

Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34:

Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On the cauterization of tumors near their abscessions.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you incise a tumor, then use a cautery that resembles a ray.

Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are formed in nature between the parts of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in their place, and the patient is frightened by this, then heal with a cautery.

When someone has an abscess in the natural cavity behind, and it is old and infected, remove the pus and corrupt humors from it, and then apply a subtle probe to the depth of the abscess, and know the quantity of its depth.

E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and the matter has been removed from it, and it has been there for a long time, then you will know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	If the matters are not left in place, then know that they are penetrating into the bones and corrupting them, or that is one of those causes from which remembrance will come to their place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter thirty-seven.

Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter thirty-eight.

Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of cauterization of the mother.

Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of cauterization of the dislocation of the arm.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moisture is infiltrated into the part of the arm, and it causes swelling at its location, and it is stretched over the other when they are compared to each other.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is often in the area where the pain is felt.

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of Cauterization of Wounds.
