De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	For the treatment of abscesses and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	You should know that every wound and abscess that becomes hidden and ancient, and is made into an ulcer, and is not consolidated and does not heal all the time and is not excised, in any member, generally it is called a fistula, and we call it an ancestral wound.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And secondly, a fistula is indeed a narrow, white, painless channel that has the same cavity as a painful ulcer; and to avoid naming it an abscess, it is called a fistula.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in moist men, the one that causes pain; and if the humidity is not removed within a few hours, it will cause damage.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this humidity is moved, and it is thin, thick, and subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already mentioned this in the division, as I said about wounds, that any ulcer that is not healed or is not in its raw flesh is not of that kind but due to one of these causes: one of which is because of pus under the skin; or maliciousness of the ulcer; or because between the ulcer and the lips there is hard flesh that prevents new flesh from growing; or because the ulcer moves, and the matter that is in it is of bad quality; or because the medicine used for its treatment is unsuitable; or when corruption catches in the region, and it becomes pestilence; or due to the nature of the region, as in Saragossa, where digestion of evils is difficult, and healing from apostema takes longer by nature; or because there are one or more abscesses.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	Here are all those causes, their symptoms, and the treatment with various medicines in this division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And now I will tell you how to treat fistulas, which are made by surgical means.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And you should know that fistulas can occur in all parts of the body; among those that come to great veins, arteries, nerves, or the spleen, intestine, bladder, or some costal bone, or some of the spinal bones of the back, or some joint composed by the union of flesh and skin; and these are those that are closest to the principal member and similar to it.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And among those fistulas that follow this pattern are difficult-to-heal wounds, do not receive treatment, and require hard work and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if the depth of some fistulas does not reach those places that have been mentioned, and you expect and believe in their treatment, and you want to reach knowledge of them, then take a probe of iron or steel, and if the fistula follows correctly, and you can reach it with this.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat. E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has very horrible symptoms, it is not possible to use the probe on it.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then clean the orifices with their own humidity, as the moisture you use to clean one spreads to the others and causes them to decay.

And then carefully inquire, according to the method that is possible for you to know if there are bones or nerves here, and whether the long or short cavity of the fistula is filled with pus, or whether it is a fistula with many openings that is spread over all of your strength, your investigation, your examination of the patient, and the invention of the cause of the pain due to your compression of the hand on the affected area, and similar meanings and causes of accidents in the abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have established all these causes with certainty, then proceed to the cure: and it is that you consider whether it is an apparent fistula near the joint, or far from it, or of nerves, or of an artery, or of a vein, or of one of the places that I have already mentioned.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then dry the fistula after it has been opened, and remove whatever is in that filter and rotten flesh, and what is born in the orifices of the flesh, or of the skin and similar, and cure that within which it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	If the fistula is of long depth and is straight, then cut it as much as possible from the front, and remove all the rotten flesh; and apply moistened bandages in acute medicines, and introduce them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have understood with a knife.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do that to it several times until the acute medicine corrodes all that is in the cavity of the fistula of the corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments that generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	If it does not heal by that, then cauterize it as we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit. If the bone is exposed and is in any corruption or blackness, then remove that within which the corruption is contained entirely; and cure that with what heals that flesh within which it is not healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and there is no bandage present as it was before, then know that you have not reached the total eradication of the corruption; and therefore you must expose it again and carefully make the reason of it and the cleaning of it with the strongest fortification tied, and then restore that.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And therefore if it is healed, well; and if not, then know that that corruption is in the depths far within the body, which has not been reached, and therefore you cannot enter into that except by laying open that.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the broken bone is small, or it is possible to pull it out, then use delicate forceps that are suitable for this.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if you have the strength to extract all of them, do so carefully without any cause that would harm your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if you encounter any resistance due to the presence of moisture, and there is no fear or mistake at the beginning, then carefully cut through those tissues or flesh that are present, and remove the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you do not have the preparation of bones from the hour, then place a poultice on that area that will help to soften the wound around those bones of flesh and tissues, and keep the poultice from being consolidated, and strengthen the section that you have incised in your operation.

De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of abdominal pain and quality of clysters with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula. Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	If the space is prolonged before corruption occurs in any member, it is called a fistula and not a fistula.

E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	When you want to heal that and extract it, it is not done without first examining its appearance and position relative to the sensation, and then strengthening what is above it and what is below it with a soft and strong bandage, and then dry it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is found in the flesh and not in the bone, then place a pointed cautery with hot fire over the area where it is located, and the main cause that is feared is corruption of it which corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that it has reached the top of the bone, then strengthen the area above it with a strong bandage, and then dry it and extract that; and advise the patient to use medications that evacuate bad humors, and guard against foods that generate putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of incision due to pain.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is not named in our land as gout, and it is pain that occurs in various members, and it is transmitted from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And now I will tell you the second thing that I will tell you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	A woman was called to a village, and it was discovered that she had a small inflammation in the vein of her arm, and after being there for an hour, it was seen that this inflammation was moving like worms in this way, more unnaturally than if it were live silver when it moves from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain went to that place and remained in the muscle, and after staying there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it corrected itself in the other arm until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre. E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen that thing in the muscles after that manner, but I had never seen anything that could cause pain to be mutated from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have not seen this anywhere among the bones here, as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I have not thought that it was this, but rather because the woman was of old age, with dry bodies and exposed veins, and in this appearance, there is that mutated warmth felt.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this appearance does not occur in those who are delicate and have humid bodies of constricted veins.

De extraccio de sagetas.	From extraction of sage.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sage is diversified according to the species, and according to the locations of the body in which they are found, because of their diversity, some have large points, and small, concave, and deaf, and they are solid; and from them there are three angles, and from those that have tongues; and from those that have stars.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	When it comes to the second part of the body and the feet in which the pain is caused by two methods: firstly, the main members such as the brain, heart, lung, and similar organs; and secondly, when pain occurs in any of these members and appears to you as a sign of death, the cause of which you should recognize and treat appropriately, if you do not see these symptoms in the majority of cases, and if the pain is not hidden deep within the member, then you should remove it and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	When symptoms occur in the servant's body and pass through the bone, and are above the skull, which is above the brain, due to severe shock, scotoma, vertigo, pain in the neck, inflammation and pain in the tongue, spasm and confusion of understanding, and vomiting of anger, and great swelling and destruction of the voice, and a white humid substance similar to pus appears at the wound site, and the flesh becomes similar to adhesion.

Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	When the thorn is close to the heart, it is close to the right breast, and feels like a hard cause, not a soft one; and the movement of the thorn is similar to the movement of the arm, and comes from the black plague, and that freezing sensation in the extremities, and sweat, and shivering; and therefore you know that death is approaching.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	When the thorn has pierced the lung almost entirely from the black buboes of the plague, and the veins that are near the neck have become inflamed, and the color of the patient changes, and they breathe heavily and ask for fresh air.

And if the thorn pierces the vein that is in the chest, and the pain is close to the small ribs, and it causes great and sudden pain and a loud cry, and does not spare all the members of the muscles.

And then remove their dresses and place them in dirty water until they are famished, and do not let any cause remain in the belly of those; and then evacuate the body at the beginning with a fleam and with lancets; and then rub the patient's member until it becomes red; and then place your hand on them.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to scratch the place with a lancet, it is better in the beginning.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with warm water and a little vinegar; and then rub and extract.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body of the patient is prolonged, then place the cage of bloodsuckers in the water, and let it soak; then you should put a cloth of freezing water on top of that until the soaking is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the swelling is multiplied, then powder it with tristanite or vinegar and similar substances according to the causes of stiptics until the swelling is broken; or place the most mature beans that have been cooked on the spot, and let them be left there until the beans adhere to the spot, and then break the swelling.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, perform transfusion of blood from suitable donors, when it is possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if blood transfusions are prohibited from suspension, then rub the spot with recent blood or insert a needle into the spots until it is no longer possible; and then place them, as those who have previously felt some blood immediately start to bleed.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop, powder those spots with a small amount of tristanite aloe, salt, or ashes, and they will stop immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	And now begins the treatment of the third part: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the restoration of fracture and accidental displacement of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, child, be wise and know that many foolish doctors and common people and those who sometimes do not follow the books of the Ancients or read one letter of them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	For this reason, this method of the sciences in our land is kept secret; and I have not done so at any time; and I have not admitted to it, but rather because of the length of reading the books of the Ancients and studying their understanding, until I extracted the science of them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then direct your attention to experiments and studies throughout the length of your life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described all of this in this chapter, which contains the greatest science and upon which I have conducted my longest experiment; therefore, I will reveal it to you others and deliver it from that occupation of elongation; and I will make it clear in the end of revelation; and I will show it in the end of declaration; and I will form it into several forms of the instruments that are administered in that, as is done by addition of declaration, as I have done in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections on the fracture of bones, from those that are necessary to mention before we begin to remember the memories of broken and different limbs of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us say in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of which in the beginning is sufficient for the craftsmen and at that time on the truth of those; so it is you and others who know or learn this noble art from others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore say that when something happens to someone with fracture or dislocation or torsion or crushing, it is necessary to begin with the incision of the flank or opening of that, or whatever means, if no cause prevents, as with the weakening of virtue, or that which happened to them, or old age, or time of great heat, or great cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content with speaking of certain herbs and meats of birds and crabs; and prohibit large meats and fill with foods and all food that fills the veins of pus, until you are sure of abscess caution, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their first regular position, which is usually the one they were in before.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so, as the broken bone begins to be restored, it is customary for the patient to be fed nutritious food that is heavy and difficult to digest, such as their food made from wheat flour, water, rice, peas, cow's milk, yogurt, fresh meat, and similar heavy and thick foods, and this diet is made by coagulation of fracture more gently and more often.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you should know that bones that break in men who are in the first stage of their life and in the elderly, it is not possible for them to continue and be consolidated according to their nature by the drying out of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are continued and consolidated according to their nature all the time by the drying out of those members, and those that continue and are consolidated at the end of the softness, such as the bones of infants.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	May nature adjust and anesthetize the affected bone, which is fractured in any part due to a similar cause such as gluttony, where it becomes swollen and strengthened, adhering to the surrounding tissues and bones, through which venom of strength and firmness enters, like fire at the beginning, until any cause does not prevent its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	For this cause, it is necessary to place the food of the patient, which has gravity, viscosity, and heaviness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Great variety of fracture according to the variety of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you know that the types of fracture are different according to the variety of members, for example, the fracture of the rib is different from the fracture of the skull; and the fracture of the rib is different from the fracture of the arm; and similarly, all other members are different from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have remembered all the types of fracture, explained in its separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Great variety of fracture in this case.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	There are various types of bone fractures in their cases; some are arc-shaped fractures, others are star-shaped fractures, and some are longitudinal fractures. Some fractures are due to the stage or asthenic constitution, and some are not. This is also the case when preparing to write, and there is a fracture with displacement in the head, and a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	In every case, there is a proper pain management in the restoration of the bone after its distinct memory comes back in its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Great severity of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	For that reason, bone fracture is recognized by its deformity, and the feeling of pain when touching it, and its location when compared to the other side.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, if there is no deformity apparent in the location and it is not caused by touching the bone when it moves and the patient does not experience great pain, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there is a twist or small fissure, where you cannot reach it with your hand and compression of the whole; then place something on it from the medicines that you remember at that moment that suits the area; and keep it straight by a subtle restriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	You should know that when the place is bent and does not split into two or another thing that does not occur in its entirety, as all parts of the patient are covered, then you should start from your own time to correct the previous that happened to the postema caution.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if the postema caution has occurred, then leave it for several days until the postema ceases; and then equalize that second by whatever method you can of lifting and of pressure.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You should know that the restoration of it and the adjustment of it is lighter than the bone in which the injury occurred to the body.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then use that second when the memory of it returns.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is injured, then it is necessary to extend this member broken in two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or if your hand is small; or if two cords or one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And place your position at the same location as the member, while the parts are extended from the member sixteen, then perforate those additions and return them to their places one by one as you can in their locations.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful not to injure the patient with your operation or cause any harm; and perforate according to your strength that you apply one bone to another as a companion according to the best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And cover that in that hour you touch your hand at the right place, and if you see any different cause here, correct it and equal it according to the amount of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid excessive extension and compression, as foolish doctors who move too much cause abscesses to occur or cause contractions in the member as we have seen through their excessive movements.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And approach the member, approach equality and proper operation and structure of that member, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient on that and make him understand that it does not harm him in the hour of his vigils and sleep, and see his rotation and agitation, and control all his movements at all times of his virtue; and wait until the position of the member is a position that ensures pain, which causes this because when feeling in the disposition of the position of the member or injury; then cover that with another position of that one that does not feel pain; and guard that that position of yours is straight and equal, so that the member does not suffer tortuosity when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the fracture of the limb depends on which one I recommend; because you know that broken limbs vary in their appearance and size and shape.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small like the arm and the hand and similar to these, it is customary to cover them with very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are large like the cushion or the chest, it is customary to cover them with a thick and durable bandage, because the lightness of the bandage connects the large member strongly and equally in all parts of the fracture, so that there is no macula.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then, as you begin, your equalization of pressure, place the bandage appropriately for that fracture, over the location of that fracture with three or four bandages after the member has softened; and strengthen your hand a little on the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to the most sunken part of the location of the fracture, and strengthen it so that your bandage does not focus on the location of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then approach the broken area with a bandage, and gradually soften the structure little by little, until you reach a large part of the area.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it around the other wound over the broken area, and gradually approach the bandages to the part behind the fracture; and your operation should be in the structure of the bandage and in the softening of the second one that we have mentioned in the first bandage.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place your hand between the bandages of the lion or cloth that is equal to the twisting of the fracture, if there is twisting in it; and if not, do not place your hand on any part of it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place your hand on the other bandage, and gently press on these sharp bandages as soon as possible, if there is inflammation or abscess in the area; and afterwards place your hand on that which secretes the abscess and which removes the inflammation; and leave it for several days; and afterwards strengthen on that.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And if the cannula of the needle is made of iron, and well formed; or of wood; or of palm fronds; and let the width of each cannula be according to this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, make sure that the star that is placed on that fracture is thicker and longer than the other stars, and the length of the star should be according to how it is attached to the member in magnitude and proportion; and strengthen the stars with another bend according to your first structure; and apply the bandage below as we have said of structure, and make sure that your structure is according to the location of the fracture, and the longer it is from the fracture, the less strict the structure.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And make sure that the threads are thick and thin in subtlety, and they should be of silk; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen by the operation of some folded threads of cords of silk being pulled through the loops, and it is a great error when the structure is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	It is not appropriate to use very thin needles, because you will not be able to pierce those that you want due to the stricture, and there should not be any gap between one needle and another of the same size.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is pulled towards the stricture by the extremities of the stirrups, then place your hand between the toes and the ankle to prevent them from being harmed by that.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some fractures are caused by impacts, and some occur in the spine, and you will find a remembrance of that in the second singularity of the capital.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that all limbs do not become straight on the first day after being broken; this is because the limb, when it is large, does not allow for any pause on the stirrups but rather approaches within 5 days or 7 or more, according to your safety from the risk of abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the method of plaster casts that the Ancients used to restore, which are placed over fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Hand cream like a remedy for restoring fractures, suitable for certain complexions and especially for women and children, which is applied to the area where there is no heat or moisture: and it is made from powdered flour, and the flour is mixed with the movement of the mold in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And if it is not like that, then grind the herb of wound, and place the compensation of the unspoken or subtle; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another remedy for restoring fractures and dislocations and twists: recipe of asafetida, of lobelia, of acacia, of elder, and myrrh, which is made from milkweed root, of all one drachm. x; of mullen and aloe root one drachm five; alochil one drachm twenty; all their crushed and ground and mixed with water or with the herb of wound if the complexion of the patient is sensitive; and then use this remedy, which is of good composition and restores the broken bones more effectively, and confers strength to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of bandaging that helps with fractures and sprains: take equal parts of mallow, marshmallow root, and white oak bark, and equal parts of acacia and Armenian bole, 20 parts.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Grind all the ingredients in a large mortar with a pestle, and their strainers, and their powders with water or egg white, and administer it.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of bandaging for joints and separated bones, and to relieve pain in those areas and in fissures and fractures: take a silk thread and soak it in a mixture of wine vinegar and oil, and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	This remedy does not have the virtue of restoration, but it is useful for treating abscesses and expelling pain properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of bandaging that restores broken bones: take willow bark and wild poppy leaves, grind them all together and make a paste from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of bandaging for promoting healing of fractured bones and when you want to resolve the chronic infection of an abscess: take powdered aloe, camomile flowers, violet flowers, flour of egg shells, and all the ingredients, grind them together and make a paste with water, if the member is not open.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is bled, then apply a moist colloidal or wet gauze and use it from there.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another way of making a more effective plaster for the recovery of the limb: take the roots of mallow, linden, balm, melilot, majorana, violet flowers, camomile, and all of them chopped; all of this is mixed with a wet or dry or honeyed sugar, according to the quality of the limb and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Ypocras should not be applied freely on the limb, but a wax cake made of wax and oil should be placed on it, not any other cause; and it is recommended that it be changed between coarseness and fineness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	Gualia is seen that it should be placed on the limb, for its recovery and the causes in which drying is small in heat, like milk, and similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Hand plaster that relieves injury and pain: take mallow, of cease, of unpeeled skins or pennyroyal, and of aloe, and of salt, all equal parts; three times the amount of honey, and beeswax, and make it into a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount should be adjusted according to the type of wound and location, considering whether it causes pain or inflammation, or if the bone is not broken, and if it is not infected, then you should not leave it for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if pain, inflammation, or swelling occurs at the location, then you should apply or remove it at that time, and leave the plaster on it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a cloth and sea sponge lion humid, and submerge it in warm water, and wring out that pain and the pain is calmed; and then let the member rest for an hour; and then place a cloth soaked in hot wine and olive oil or rose oil on it, and leave it on for a night until you are sure of abscess cautery, and that inflammation of the member has subsided, and that pain from it is relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat. And if you see that the abscess and the redness and the pain and the swelling and all the accidents have already disappeared from everywhere, and if you need to apply bandages and constraints, then you should do so equally as you did at the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no harm has occurred to the member from those which we have said, then do not remove it for three days or four or five or six; and some days all of this is left until twenty days after you appear by the removal of the member, as we have said, before the fracture adheres, and it settles on the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust in the constraint more than in your first constraint, and adjust in the increase of the food of the patient, after it is preceded by his remembrance.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you see that the location of the fracture has already dried up and become more extensive than it should be, then know that the nourishment should not reach that place; therefore, apply a cool, smooth liniment to that area for the entire duration of the treatment; and this should be done for three days in total; and gradually loosen the restriction, and for this operation, the nourishment reaches the member, and it is healed more effectively.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	If that which the foolish restorers of the broken member do not restore to its original state when it is not healed, according to the correct method, and if they restore it according to its tortuosity, that is also incorrect according to their operation, and there is great fear that if that is done, it will increase the ancient evils in their free works and harm them.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, so it is more reasonable that they should not do that.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: Of fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are varied, and their shapes are different, and their causes are distinct, because some fractures are caused by percussion of space, and the percussion penetrates all the bone into the marrow, which is behind the bone, just as it does in the staff, and for that reason this type is called ascial; or the space enters a certain part of the bone, and enters the flesh of it and does not pass the incision through the back of it; and this type of fracture is called absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the severity of these two fractures is great or small, and of the fracture that is contracted or atrophied; and the cause of it is percussion with a pole or stone, and similarly.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is so deep that it approaches the peritoneum which is next to the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the severity of these two fractures is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of the fracture that is bent in the bone, in the thinness of the hair, and for that reason this special fracture is called hairline.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And this fracture is made by impact or percussion of stone, and similarly, which makes some bone plate enter into the fractures, and it is made in the concave place where such accidents occur to the ribs when they are struck and the fragment enters into the fractures.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this is more commonly made in the bodies of human beings, such as their ribs and skulls.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these special types of fractures are stable, as if separated by stitches.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you will find the removal of everything in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And you will recognize all these special types of fractures by detection on those and by investigation of their attempts and the corruption of flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And a special type of fracture is recognized by the fact that it is discovered on the bone, and it is cleaned, and it is applied to the attempt, where the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fractures, consider the initial symptoms of the patient, and if you see by the symptoms that mean manifestly by fever, such as vomiting from colera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and abscesses of the mouth, and sincopi, and acute fever, and inflammation of the joints and pain in those, and similar to their symptoms in the major dispositions, they are not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see that the symptoms do not correspond to health, then you should begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	When this cause occurs, if it comes to you in the beginning as it is usually found and it is in the days of winter, then study the position of the bone during the day number fourteen, completely arranged.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then study the position of the bone during the seventh day, having that which is left of the pancreas be corrupted, and that accidents occur as we have previously mentioned.

And if the fracture has already reached the pancreas, covering the brain, and is small and atrophied, then study the incised part, divided and atrophied, according to what I will recommend to you.

And if you raise the head of the patient, and discover over the bone according to custom and your possible method according to the figure of the wound, and that it is lighter on the patient.

And if an accident occurs to you in the detection of the bone, flow of pus or abscess cautiously, then you stop at that place and wait for it to be over, and fill the place with linen cloths infused in wine and olive oil, and make a dressing on the wound until the abscess is sedated, and be sure of flow of pus; and then begin in the circumference of the bone and in its removal.

And these are not called anything else but those that do not penetrate the end of the bone where you will place them, so that the trepan has a rounded extremity or margin on that which is left after removing the sharp edge like a margin or small circle, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the density of the bone.

It is advisable to take a large number of these needles that are suitable for each bone, entering into all the tests of the brain where the end is sharp, the quantity in length and brevity should be according to the quantity of sharpness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	This is the form of three kinds of needles: The quality of piercing through the circle of the broken bone is that you place the needle on the bone and revolve it around its tips until you know that the bone has already been penetrated; then move the needle to another location, and pause where the thickness of the ray or around that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert the most subtle forceps that you can over that in case of fracture, as we have said, until you remove the bone, or with your hand, or with some other cause for the disturbance of those that will appear at that, as delicate scissors and forceps.

And thus, when you have circled the bone perforation, and if it is continued with the same instrument, and then extracted, it is similar to a scalpel, but rather more sharp and more delicate than other scalpels.

Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	About the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You should know that the nose is not broken into two pieces equally, but rather one piece is more rounded and has some bone, while the other part is cartilaginous and does not break easily and only changes in shape and size.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	If one of the two pieces is broken, then introduce the broken piece back into the nose and align it with the fracture using the other piece, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this with your hands to facilitate the operation and be careful not to cause any harm to the patient during the procedure.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and it does not permit to see through that area, then cover it with a small round piece.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And cover it with a bandage for the restoration of the fracture on the first day after the injury, if possible; otherwise, approach the seventh or eighth day and apply the healing ointment to the wound.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then insert a piece of cloth into the tip of the nose, if the fracture is in one part, or place two splints, if the fracture is in two parts, and let them fill up to such an extent that they block the nostril.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And tell the ancient healers that the splints should be wrapped in bread and changed daily, but I have not seen this; instead, cover the cloth with a piece of compressed charcoal powder to help the bone heal and strengthen the cartilage.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And some bandages should be inserted into the nose, in place of a sponge, instead of being wrapped in a cloth of lion's mane; and if the fracture of the nose is very violent and the patient is not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This cause is not necessary for you; if you want to do it, then do so, and if you want to make splints.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another bandage causes an abscess, apply a plaster to the nose with wax or with a solution of honey and rose oil, or with diachylon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if no abscess occurs, then cover the wound with a plaster made of starch and powdered ivy leaves and egg white; and place it on the lion's mane cloth, and do not let the nose come into contact with any cause.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken or fractured, then cover them with a plaster and remove those with instruments that are appropriate for those; and cover the wound, and treat it with something that heals and consolidates, and with a suitable plaster.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	If there is bleeding from the nose, then apply pressure with cloths and administer tampons of lead into it until it is completely stopped.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter 4.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture does not cause pain, look to see if the fracture is only slightly deformed and not completely separated into two pieces, but curved to the parts inside, then it is not displaced.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is in the middle, then introduce your finger into the patient's mouth on the left side; and similarly, if the fracture is on the right jaw, then introduce your finger into the patient's mouth on the right side; and push against that softness of the fracture from inside with your other hand on the deformed part of the bone; and gradually equalize both sides.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two pieces, then apply traction to both parts in a straight line until it is possible to equalize them.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is a dislocation of teeth that leads to their displacement, then use those that are hoped to remain intact; such as gold, silver, or cedar; and place them on the broken jaw, and place them on the doubled cloth, and place them on the large sheet that has been properly made, or a weight of equal length to the jaw; and hang it above the second one according to what you have prepared for its application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to rest and find tranquility, and place a drink of lion's saliva on their lips.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you suspect that the body has been altered in some way, then remove it on the third day; and correct what has been altered from it and apply that with powder of millstone, egg album, or cisami flour, before you have removed the bandage from it, and place a lion's skin on the application.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then with this annex and adjust the application on it, and if the position of the bone has not been altered, leave it until it is healed and strong; for this fracture is usually healed in three months.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another complication occurs with an abscess, then administer the same medicine that we have mentioned for other complications in its treatment until it is healed, and let that abscess remain.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is severely displaced, then consider whether the separated bone is short or long, and if it is short, then use a device that is suitable for removing those from instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the openings of the wound are narrow, then use a forceps according to the amount of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have reattached those separated parts, and if those do not remain, then widen the openings of the wound if they are not already wide; otherwise, place one of the suitable dressings on it and cover it until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the wishbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The wishbone is broken at the part where it connects to the shoulder blade, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	When the bone is broken, or separated, or separated into two parts that do not match; and it is easier to restore it; or if there are fragments in the wound, and it is difficult to restore it; or if the fracture is complicated.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	In that case, the operation in which the fracture is complicated, you should have two assistants, so that one holds the broken furcula and follows it, and the other stretches the neck to that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then align the fracture with the ribs, before it is made in the shape of a second rib, and not in the elevation or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then cover it with cloth or wool, and its size according to the amount of your need; extend and elevate the broken furcula and tie the cloth to your hand until the fracture is aligned in the shape of a second rib.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot tie the end of the furcula to the parts forward, so that it reaches the pronator, then cover the patient with a pillow on their neck, and place a larger cushion over the muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant pushes the muscle of the patient to the parts that were inside when the bone of the furcula was raised and placed on top of it, and then you correct the fracture and equalize it with those called tendons.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel pain in the furcula and its muscles, then cover that area and remove those pains for ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is held in the bone, then you make an incision in it with one of the scissors that you have prepared for this, because you have placed under the furcula the instrument that serves the chisel; and this instrument is a hammer or a hammer of which this is the shape of it:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a mallet of which this is the concavity; and its width should be according to that which you need from it, according to the size of the bone or the weakness of it.
