Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	And its length should be according to what is possible for the operation; that it has two ends, and one end should be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound that you have incised when you extracted the splinter of the bone is wide, and it is certain of abscess formation, then adjust the two edges of the wound with sutures.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear abscess formation, then fill the wound with dressings and powders according to the size of the wound's opening.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess forms, then pour in some cloth soaked in warm water and rose oil, and place it on the affected area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the structure of the bone when it is cut and separated, place a poultice made of flour of milled wheat and egg yolk on it, and place it on the affected area. Then place a piece of soft cloth over the poultice, if necessary, and then apply humate, which is a long strip of linen, about one palm wide; and then place powdered duplicatz on the poultice and the cloth; and then place a thin tablecloth over it in a drap, and place the tablecloth over the location of the fracture; and then apply humate as it is soaked, and roll it up on the neck of the patient and under the chin of the patient, and then place it over all the parts. And when the structure of the fracture descends, and that is what is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And even if the splint above the broken bone is not maggot-infested; and so that you can see the patient every day, when the bandage becomes soft or you replace the splint, then you should straighten it again and strengthen the fracture.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's pillow on their shoulder, and place another pillow under their arm to support the patient's arm on the side of that one, so that the fracture of the clavicle at the elevation of the muscle is elevated; or the arm of the patient is placed on the shoulder of that one.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not change the bandage unless there is an abscess or pus in the place within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you have seen the surface of that at this, and adjust it to the fracture and restore it until it is restored and the fracture of the clavicle has coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the measure in twenty-eight days, and some changes are made in men of that time.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a broken shoulder joint.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	A splint is broken in the wrong place and not at the fracture site, but on its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	Therefore, when the splint is broken at the wrong place - and it is broken in the right place - and it is not known except by touching, then according to the figure of the fracture, prepare the splint and reduce it to its natural shape in any way possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then place a layer of powdered egg white and lemon juice on the fracture site; then place a layer of doubled cloth on it; and then place a thin layer of table salt according to the amount of the broken splint or more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	If the layer is concave at any point of the splint, then level that concavity with lemon juice, and then place the layer evenly.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then apply pressure above with blood-letting to prevent the swelling of the layer until it is not removed from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the bandage on each day; and all the time that it is softened, tie another bandage and strengthen it and equalize the pressure if it remains in its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And place the patient on their left side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spoon is restored in 10 days or in 25.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when this number is completed, then you dissolve the bandage, and make sure that it is not from the bones of which its beginning was not feared nor its dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the location of the bone and place it behind the chain, then you cut it on it, and hold it, and do as we have said in the fracture of the furcula of sadacio de apostema caut if something happens here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the chest.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The chest is broken in the middle of its location and that part remains unchanged; but the ends of it are somewhat attached and comminuted.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	When the patient's leg is broken, it bends towards the sides and causes great pain, difficulty in breathing, cough, vomiting, and fever; and it is declared in the cavity of the broken bone and is not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	The restoration of the broken bone is that the patient should be placed on their back, and a cushion is placed between their shoulder blades; and then the muscles are pressed on the bone, and the ribs of the patient are adjusted to the position of two straight lines, and the operation is performed according to all possible and appropriate methods until the figure of the bone returns as it was.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Then place a poultice and bandage over the broken bone, and place a soft cloth or a piece of calico over it to cover it; and then carefully apply it to the broken bone so that it is not painful; and when the swelling subsides, strengthen it with a suitable support; and consider the swelling at all times, and when it becomes soft, strengthen it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary to remove the bandage or compress that was previously applied, causing pain, swelling, abscess, or other issues in that area, then you should remove and discard it, and apply a new ointment to treat the issue. If necessary, reduce the pressure of the bandage, and adjust it until the patient is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the ribs when they are punctured.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You should know that fractures of the ribs do not occur in the larger, stronger parts, but only at their ends, where they meet the lungs, and these parts are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And if the patient is not conscious due to the pain, you should perform the examination without their knowledge or consent.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be done in such a way that it matches the fracture as much as possible, and then covered with a bandage, and then apply an ointment and splint to support the broken bone, if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the rib fracture is declining towards the internal parts, the patient experiences severe pain and puncturing, similar to the puncturing experienced by someone who has cried out, and because of this, the bones are covered with a bandage; and they experience difficulty in handling, coughing, and vomiting, and this is difficult to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the ancients had methods for treating such great pain.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And they said: cover the patient's belly with warm and moist cloths to generate inflammation and moisture, so that the belly is swollen and extended, and the fracture is pushed towards the external parts.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we do not do this because it is not a cause of pus formation that could lead to abscess, unless it has already occurred; and if it has already occurred, then we help with that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they said: place the patient on their back and bring them close to a strong fire; this is similar to reasoning, but it is feared that the fire will draw excessive heat to the wound due to its weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And they say to the patient: cover that place with wool that has been submerged in hot oil, and place powder between their ribs until it is full, which is as heavy as when you wrap a second layer; and then cure the patient with the care of pleurisy from food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the patient is strongly constricted and has not suffered from it, and the bones push the bandage against the puncture, then cover the patient, and discover the broken rib, and place your hand over that instrument which contains the cipher, the memory of which is preceded, and cut the bones to facilitate its removal.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then adjust the torn lips of the wound, if it is large, with suture, and treat that with ointments until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if an abscess is formed, then you should cover it and insert powder in hot oil and place it over the wound, and treat the patient with that which covers the abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And let him lie on his left side while he is sleeping until he is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the sacrum and coccyx.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some fractures occur in the bones of the neck, and they are often accompanied by their attachment, and similarly to the sacrum of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when such an accident occurs to anyone and you want to know whether they will be healed or not, consider the following: if their bones are already softened and stupefied and dead and cannot move them or extend them or strengthen them and when you press on them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and they do not feel pain in them, then know that they are not healed, and in such cases the prognosis is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if they feel pain in them when you press on them with your fingers or prick them with a needle, then know that the neck of the bone is saved and that the patient will recover.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see similarities in the sacrum of the neck and want to know whether they will be healed or not, then consider their feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	If you notice that it has already softened, then apply those things that are usually applied to the muscles, and when it is on its back, it becomes relaxed and unable to urinate, and some patients turn over onto their backs and want to urinate but cannot, then you know that it is fatal, and therefore do not treat it.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	If none of those things happen, the cause is better and less dangerous.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	The treatment of it is to apply a poultice made of bread soaked in rose oil or mustard plaster, or some other medicinal herbs; place it on the affected area for several days until the abscess is sedated.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And later apply one of the comforting and existing plasters, and strengthen it on that area; command the patient to use rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the side where the pain occurs until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if the tissue of the bone is affected or some other cause that has already been separated from it, then apply pressure on the wound and remove that bone; and then adjust the edges of the wound, using sutures if necessary; and then care for that area with some healing ointment until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	If the back of the thigh bone is fractured, and it is at the end of the spine, then enter your left hand into the anus, and balance the broken bone with your right hand as much as possible for equality; and place a poultice and bandage on it, if necessary, and strengthen it.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel shattered bones in it, then treat that, and hold it, and cure the wound with the cure that is preceded by it until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the restoration of the wide.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the ribs are broken, and if they break, then the fracture of them is only communication at the ends of those and are inserted in length and decline to the parts inside; and the patient feels pain in that place and puncture, and the cushion is surprised when the fracture occurs.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over it so that it is over the fracture, which is its figure.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	If the fracture is only in the end of it, then you equal it to the second one that you have at hand for equality, and enter as much as it is necessary to be assembled to its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the long or that already declines to the parts behind, then you make the patient lie on their belly until they are prepared for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And then when you have equalized that one, place your hand on the plaster, and place your other hand on that star of wood or of codeine, and strengthen for stricture on the one that you do not fear puncturing of fracture or removal of the star.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And equal the hollowness with that which placed that one inside of which that fracture has the stricture according to equality, and command the patient to lie on their side or on their back.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if there is an abscess, then you stop the extension of it and the restoration until that one is sedated, and place your hand on that which is preceded; and then return to the restoration of it, and strengthen that one with a cover.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	If there are fractures or dislocations in the bones, then you should treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the humerus.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	This is the part that is between the ribs and the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, the restoration of it is in one of two ways, one of which is that you hold it like this:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And if it is attached to two ends of two bands, and then suspended from the raised place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And the patient should lie on a bed; and then remove the broken arm over the splint that reaches the tip of it in the middle place where the curve of the bone is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend something heavy over it, or the nurse extends it to the parts that are behind; and then the doctor should put something in between the fracture as soon as possible until the fracture returns as it was before.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other handmaid should place the patient on their back and support their head with a cloth; and then command two ministers that one of them holds what is above the fracture with their hands, and the other holds the pillow behind the patient; and each of them extends their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then place your strength on the fracture with the cloth and on the other cloth, and each of the two ministers extends their part.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is close to the end of the muscle, then cover that half of the cloth over the wound and the other behind the fracture on the side.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly, if the fracture is on the side, then cover that cloth over that place and on that side.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Equalize that with ease and effort, and when it is applied according to how it covers and is applied properly, then apply strength to it if there is no pus caution.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	If an abscess occurs, leave the restriction in place until the seventh day, and place your hand on the wound to prevent it from reopening until the abscess heals, and then you should strengthen that area.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	The method of strengthening that area is to apply a plaster on the fracture, and then cover it with a clean cloth; and then place your arm over the support, and place your hand on their muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And then cover the cloth and strengthen the arm over the support to prevent it from becoming weak, unless there is some cause for the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And then place the splint that is closest and strongest to the others; and between each splint, leave a space equal to the thickness of the splints added together, three times the width of each piece.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen over the splints with the restriction that I mentioned at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And ensure that your structure over the location of the fracture is straight.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And if the fracture is more elongated, the structure should be smaller.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And if you see the position of the splints and the structure as we have said in the hour when you restore the member to its usual position, then do so.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear abscess, then leave the structure and the splints in place as we have said for day seven.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days to prevent it from happening in the location or inflammation; or eating is prohibited to come to the member because of the disposition of superfluous structure; and therefore adjust everything as we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are sure that no cause of this will happen, then do not remove the ligature for three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And the patient's head should be on their back, and their hands should be over their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place your hand on the helper full of wool equally, and consider in all hour of the night or day that the figure of the broken member is not melted or dissolved, or that the ligament is softened, therefore adjust everything according to your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And pause the patient's food according to the order we have given, unless the food is delicate at the beginning until it is started to be strong; and afterwards cover that food with a cloth.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	It is customary for the helper and the servant of the patient to be strong for 14 days; and afterwards cover that food with a cloth, and administer it washed and medicated with those remedies that rectify that one.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is not united, then do not remove that bandage and those splints within one day or within two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of the restoration of a broken arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones, which are called two bones; one is small, and that is the one that secures the wrist, and the other is large and that is the one that is placed behind the small one from the wrist upwards.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And if the larger bone or the smaller one is broken alone, or both are broken at once.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	When the small intestine is cut above, its restoration is difficult, and its healing is even more difficult.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	When the large intestine is cut below the fracture of the patient, its healing is bad, and its recovery is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And even worse when two bones are broken.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is cut above the small intestine, it is advisable for the doctor to facilitate its healing by applying a small extension as soon as possible.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the large intestine is that which is cut, then it is necessary to apply a more forceful extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both intestines are cut at the same time, then it is necessary to apply a stronger extraction.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And it is necessary to place the patient's hand on the extraction and the extension of the intestine on a cushion, with the fingers above, not like all the others, and the ear should be lower than the others, and the patient should lie on a pillow that has been placed.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And place a cushion under their back or head, so that the patient does not tire.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	Then the assistant extends their arm on the side farthest from the patient's hand or head, and another assistant extends their arm similarly above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	Then the doctor adjusts the bone as best as possible according to its figure.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there are thorns in the surface of the bone, then you should carefully remove all of them from their location with your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears to be a separate thorn that pierces the skin and is not within your hope for its restoration, then you should do something on it and place it according to the method we mentioned above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is widespread, you have already done something similar to that, and therefore take care of that treatment.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your restoration, then you should apply a cloth made of olive oil and white wax, and it should be thin yet strong, and place it over the subtle structure within which the abscess is to be covered; and then remove the cloth and apply a prepared plaster made of powdered myrrh and clay, and place it on the fracture.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And you know that the number of the ribs in the arm is in the major positions, or if it is a fracture in one bone or two bones together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	And then place your bandage over the location of the fracture as strongly and vigorously as possible, and when more of the bandage is above the fracture or below it, place the bandage a little softer than it was previously mentioned in the beginning of this chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths that are wrapped around the fracture should be soft cloths, and not hard or rough, and the best one is the one that is strengthened just enough to move between being thin and thick, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the member and the limb nearby those days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if something happens that requires correction, such as the one that happened to the member, and then make sure that you immerse the member in water before it stops that problem.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And do not keep the member pressed until it recovers, and then return the bandage.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the contraction has already been softened and the bone has already regained its shape and appearance like those, then with your skill, correct all of that.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider if the nourishment is prohibited from reaching the member due to excessive stricture, then gradually loosen that one a little and allow it to heal for several days until the nourishment can reach it, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	However, if the patient has not experienced any of those causes that we have mentioned, then do not allow it to be discharged within 20 days or around those days.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And have the hand of the patient suspended over them by their skill of moving it, and make that one sleep on their side.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And you will know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or 32 days, or if it is well-healed in 28 days, and all of this depends on the disposition of the conditions and the dispositions of the skill.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	Of the restoration of the broken pinch of the hand and those.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	You should know that the joint of the hand and the knuckles of those are often fractured, but this does not happen to them unless there is a strong impact.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	And when the hand is fractured or injured, the patient should lie down and keep their hands at the same level, and place your hand over the extended one.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	And then the assistant extends the broken bones and the doctor aligns them with good alignment.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	And then place a bandage and hold it, if there is no pus carefully; and place this above according to the size of the wound, and you have already wrapped that in cloth.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	But if the splint is in the parts of the belly of the palm, and then make something similar to a bandage, and command the patient to hold that on their palm splint; then it should be strongly bound with the cloth long.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And if the patient's chest is covered with cloth in which they are lying, so that the chest can be applied to the palm; and strengthen the second one that covers.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	If the fracture is at the front parts, then place your hand over the other cloth on the part that is underneath, so that the hand can be opened and straightened; and then place the bandage, as if it is rolled up with the hands between the said arm bones.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if the fracture occurs in one of the said joints, then if it is said to be broken, then cover it as soon as possible and strengthen it with the palm and if desired, place a small straight bandage so that the fracture can be elevated and not become deformed.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	And if the fracture is in the other said joints, such as in the wrist, or in the elbow, or in the ear, or in the ring finger, then it should be covered and tied with the said bandage that was used for that; or all of them should be tied continuously, and this is better; or place over that small bandage, as we have said in the wrist.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And consider, in your restoration, and approach that, the arrangement of an abscess cautery and oppose — against the surgical operation — against that which covers when something happens to one of those, according to what is related about it.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter 14.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the bone of the thigh.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bones of the thigh are broken and it is declared to the sensation after it is converted to the part where it is most painful.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration of it is done in such a way that the bandage is applied over the fracture and another bandage under the fracture, and the patient lies on their back and on their face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And the assistant extends the bandage to its part according to its quality, when the fracture is in the middle of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it is planned to the thigh's joint, then the bandage should be placed on the knee to the part of the femur, so that the extension can be in its place, and the other bandage under the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And if the fracture is towards the knee, then make the bandage prepared for the knee, and extend it to the parts nearby.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And if the doctor is able to place the bones in their natural position and the bone is joined by good connection; then cover it with a plaster and bandage, unless there is an abscess in the member.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if there is an abscess in the member, then leave it for several days until the abscess drains, and then return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The bandage of the fracture should be made as follows: cover the fracture with a hard bandage, fold it twice or three times, and remove any excess; then wrap the calf where it meets the thigh and the back of the knee.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And introduce a long felt between the knee and the calf towards the knee, and the ends of the felt should be from the most upper part of the two parts, and then wrap it over the calf and the knee what remains excessive from the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then place your hand on the cushion in the location of that fracture, and place one stone on the bones of the bed.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill the empty space between the bed and the cushion with many cloths, to prevent the contraction from coagulating.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then begin the contraction strongly from the middle over the location of the fracture with three or four layers, and as you approach the edge of the fracture location, your contraction should be smaller and more loose and moist.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And then extend both ends of the strap to the parts where it reaches the cavity of the foot, and strengthen both ends of the stones on the other side so that the cloth does not remain in its own location.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And then lay the contraction on that, so that none of those things happen to the member, corrosion, abscess, inflammation, and similar to those; and if any of those things happen, then count yourself as having removed it from there, and rectify what happened as soon as possible, according to what we have said.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is fractured where it breaks, then try to align it as much as possible; if not, break it and return it to its place, and treat that which is preceded by a memory of healing within which it can be cured.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And some bands are strengthened with this fracture of the cushion or another that is adjusted to its steps, as we have said in the assistant and in the arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	However, in the restoration of it in such a way that it does not occur to the patient with paralysis; and if it is restored alone, then another should be applied on the other cushion, it is necessary that he should immediately move that which is preceded by it.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	And you should know that the cushion is strengthened in ten days or a few more or a few months, and all of this depends on the diversity of the conditions and other arrangements.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the knee cap.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	When a fracture of the little toe occurs, it is often accompanied by injuries to the surrounding muscles and tendons.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	However, if the injury occurs at the fracture site, it is either a crack or a tear in its parts, and this is either a pain or a severe pain, and over it all is the sensation of pain.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	The restoration of it is such that it should be equal to what was broken from its parts, and it should be attached and joined together as much as possible by equality and facility and craftsmanship.
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	Then place a bandage and place it over that round stone, if necessary for that; and strengthen the structure with it as appropriate.
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	Then consider all the dispositions that we have recommended for other fractures, such as the abscess cautery and similar to those that should be applied to the whole accident as appropriate until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the knee.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the chest there are two bones, one of which is large and called the sternum; and the other is thin and called the clavicle.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And depending on the type of fracture that occurs in those two bones of the arm, and for that reason, restoration of it is made as with restoration of the arm equally, and the operation of it is one.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if both bones are broken together, the chest is converted into all parts.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the thin bone is broken, the chest is converted into the front parts.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the large bone is broken, then that one behind, and it is of those causes that are not within your knowledge.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And then administer extension and equality and ligaments of the ribs according to that equally.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	But may it be, if the fracture of the chest is not healed without having any signs of movement, then the extension should be less and looser, and it will help your skill.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the bed, there is a cause for operation on the arm, and it is when you straighten the fingers and complete the entire operation, then you will take weights of iron that are placed next to the causes that are placed on the soles, and they are made entirely of white palm leaves; attach them to those that have a small groove, and do not be like the hands, and be the longest of those that are the longest in the bed, and of the denoun under the foot.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And then cover each with a blanket in two layers according to its length, and place one on the side of the bed on one side and the other on the other side, and they should be made of denoun from under the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And then place the blankets in three layers at the extremities of the bed and at the middle, so that at this structure the bed is prohibited from tilting to the right and left side, and it is a good position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And already a small board of wood according to the length of the bed; and it should be placed on the bed so that it keeps the patient from moving.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	When you do this in a fracture, and when it is properly placed.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And consider each day the bed and study it for the next day's study, and keep it from abscess and inflammation or other similar causes; and if any of those causes occur, then stop that treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the talus and bones of the foot and those called.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	Fracture of the talus does not occur in all cases; rather, fractures occur in some bones of the foot, and fewer fractures occur in those called, and they do not occur to them but rather in the same positions.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot suffer fracture and sometimes those bones are raised above themselves between them, then place the patient on his side with his foot prepared as if walking.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And then place one foot on that which is raised from those bones, and press them, and equalize them until they return to their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then place a poultice and a bandage on top of it, and place a small table under the patient's belly with two cloths on it.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And then pull the patient's leg towards the body structure below, as you have covered that area with cloths and other materials of which they are in need.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when the patient has passed three or four days, then you will remove the bandage, as you found the bones in equal condition, or they were fractured or dislocated, and the operation was done with such precautions.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if you say they are fractured, then restore those, and equalize them with the other side, and recommend to you in the restoration of the mentioned method of the foot.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And then place the fractured bone along its length, and place it close to the patient's leg; and place the table under the patient's body, which has been recommended to you, and pull the patient's leg towards the body structure below.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if that which is fractured from the bones is two or three or more, then you will place each piece of the required amount wrapped in a lion cloth on top of it, and pull the table under the patient's body, and stand on one of the tablecloths over the patient's belly to keep it warm.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	It is necessary for you to remember that you should not neglect all the causes that were mentioned to you in the other fractures of accidents that we have discussed; and pause at all times to consider this.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of the fracture of the clavicle, the scapula, and the humerus in a man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the clavicle is fractured, then perform that operation in a lying position, and gradually incline it to the side of the back a little, and hold it behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then the midwife should place her hand on the clavicle of the other side, and do the same as before; and the arm should be gently shaken, and the back of the person lifted a little at a time, until the fractured part of the clavicle is returned to its position.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And then place cushions on the back of the person, and when they need to urinate, raise their back and let them urinate, and reduce and return that second as was done at the beginning, and then return to the first cushion.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And make this for seven days or around those, until he is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take an egg yolk and strengthen it with a strong herb through a canavera needle; and insert the entire egg yolk into the wound, and blow into the canavera until the egg yolk is inflated with the wound, where the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be filled with cotton and kept warm for several days until he is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bones of a man or woman are fractured, then administer in the healing and setting of that bone what we have recommended for the bone of the thigh.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And that which is directed should not be hidden in these nearby fractures and that it does not happen, mainly to the one who has some study and use and understanding of this my book; because that fracture means to you in the greatest dispositions via dreyturiera in the healing and setting of that bone, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	When the man's back is bent, take a blanket, and place it on his back; then cover him with a cloth, and wrap him in it, and keep him that way for three days or until he is cured.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the treatment of bone fractures when they are displaced.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for the person who has a displaced fracture, and especially if the bone is large and thick like the bones of the thigh or arm, or similar to those, that you first examine them and perform amputation if the conditions for amputation are present as we have previously mentioned.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the displacement heals, then cover it with a bandage and apply a powder made of three parts sulfur to prevent further displacement.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to treat the fracture in that place, but do not prolong it if there is no pus.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	If there is pus, then leave the treatment of it until the ninth day, before the pus disappears, and do not approach it on the third or fourth day, as you will cause further harm.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	If the bone is fractured and elevated above the shoulder, then cover it with a cloth and place it back in its position, and hold it with your hands to facilitate and minimize extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	If the extension is not in your prepared position and the balance of the patient, then reduce it with this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, its length being seven or eight spans, and its width according to the size of the wound; and for that reason, the doctor must have three or four of these instruments according to the quantity needed in treatment for all types of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And if it is round, and in the small groove for the reason that it is not bent, then place the handle on it during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And if it is sharp at the end that has a margin on its ends; and if it is below it to the greatest extent, and from the top of it into the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is the shape of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And in Greek it is called "willing labor pain", which is a rare thing.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that the patient's limb can be placed on top of the elevated part of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And push it into a tube that returns the bone, and be equal to some balance.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And so force yourself to equal the limbs of the fracture between them, and if the limb of that is thinly broken, and you do not take it with the tool for good reason, then you should insert the limb of that bone into where the tool has power over it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone to all of that, then insert it into where the scissors or saw that we have mentioned would go; or press that with one of the saws in some way that is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And remove those that are in the bone of roughness and small scratches.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and the reduction of the patient brings great pain, then you know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do what you have agreed upon with the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your bone fracture is healed, and then submerge it in a tight, dark bandage, especially in summer, and do not place it on a hot surface or other cause that could cause further injury and decomposition.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer splints at the time of the patient's complete healing of the bone fracture, and leave the surface exposed to avoid any infection that may occur due to the use of bandages according to the size of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be very careful not to expose the wound to the fracture, as it may cause further injury or infection, which could lead to serious complications.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the patient's fracture is loose, soft, and different from other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is large or bad, and you fear any of those bad accidents that we have mentioned, and there is great pain in the area, then do not place those splints on it, but rather use a hard cloth bandage instead of splints and press lightly on those areas.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	When the pain starts to occur one or two days ago, and it is believed to be caused by a fracture, then remove the cloth that was placed on the affected area, and administer ointments, using those that are customarily used to treat wounds, such as quadripharmacon and similar ones.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is advised to you that you remove the bandage and consider the wound on each day at dawn and evening, until it is consolidated and healed, and make sure that the member is prepared in such a way that the pain runs from it to the parts behind, for facilitation.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the wound lasts for several days and it is not consolidated or healed from it, then know that this is a sign of small bones being broken, and therefore you should examine the wound to see if it is infected.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those small bones that are separated and remained inside, those that do not separate and put the member and make it impossible to move, you should incise those that are possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	If the wound becomes infected with a certain kind of corruption or putrefaction, and it is necessary to apply a specific remedy for that, which was previously described in the chapter about its treatment.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding that remedy in which you should use your best judgment and present your remedy: when the large pieces are cut off, elevate it over the affected member as if it were bones of the cushion and assistant, and similar to those of large members, and do not assume attraction or extraction of it, which may cause death; leaving that in place for a few days, which will help to heal the wound within 20 or 30 days; and then cure the wound if you have seen it, and if not, leave it.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the treatment of a lump that occurs at the site of some fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	This lump often occurs at the site of fracture healing, and more so near joints, and is shaped like a member; and it prevents the member from performing its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the wound is recent and administer medicines such as aloes, and bandages, and compresses, and astringents, and similar to those; in which you take some or all of them, and confirm that they are astringent, or albumen of egg, or astringent wine, and place that over the wound in a stopper, and bind it well.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And do not loosen that bandage for several days; and remove it and apply another, until the wound is healed; or strengthen it on that layer of plaster, which has the property of reviving everything that is inflated in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the wound has become a hard and tight scar that always provokes pain, then cut it along the most inflamed part of it, and remove the excess and eminent, or ratze that with an acid rezerve until it is healed; and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	When the broken bone is restored and placed back into its natural position, it is not always as smooth and flexible as before.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a broken bone is restored, and the member becomes smooth and flexible again, this is not always done for multiple reasons: one of which is the lack of solution to the ligaments and tendons of the fractured area, as they do not heal properly; or due to excessive stricture of the ligaments, preventing nutrients from reaching the member; or due to excessive use of ointments; or due to unnecessary movement at an inappropriate time; or due to weakness in the body of the patient and their overall weakened state.
